etymologies: early 17th century: from Virginia Algonquian aroughcun

definitions: a grayish-brown American mammal that has a foxlike face with a black mask and a ringed tail.

notes.text: Genus Procyon, family Procyonidae (the raccoon family): two species, in particular the common raccoon (P. lotor), which often occurs in urban areas in North America. The raccoon family also includes the coati, kinkajou, cacomistle, and olingo

shortDefinitions: greyish-brown American mammal which has foxlike face with black mask
